container.heading: Special Operation Licenses for Instant Ticket Lottery Machines

para.text: This chapter applies to a retailer that is a veterans’ services organization and applies for and sells tickets under a special operation license for instant ticket lottery machines.

In addition to the requirements of this chapter, a veterans’ services organization licensed to sell tickets from an instant ticket lottery machine shall meet the requirements of this subtitle for a retailer licensed by the Agency.
In this chapter, the following terms have the meanings indicated.
Terms Defined.
“Cashout voucher” means a printed slip of paper with a code indicating the amount of money payable to the individual who presents the ticket to an operation licensee.

“Contractor” or “Agency’s contractor” means a company selected by the Agency for the design, development, installation, implementation, operation, and maintenance of the Agency’s Instant Ticket Lottery Machine system.
“Facility” means the building where an operation licensee places instant ticket lottery machines.
“Instant ticket” means a preprinted ticket purchased from an instant ticket lottery machine.
“Instant ticket lottery machine” means a machine or other device provided to a retailer through the Agency’s contractor.
“Operation licensee” means the holder of a special operation license.
“Special operation license” or “operation license” means permission granted by the Agency under this chapter to sell instant tickets.
“Veterans’ services organization” means an organization that is:
Tax exempt and organized as a veterans’ organization under §501(c)(19) or §501(c)(4) of the United States Internal Revenue Code; and
Located in:
Allegany County;
Anne Arundel County;
Baltimore City;
Baltimore County;
Calvert County;
Carroll County;
Charles County;
Frederick County;
Garrett County;
Harford County;
Howard County;
Montgomery County;
Prince George’s County;
Saint Mary’s County; or
Washington County.
A veterans’ services organization may not operate instant ticket lottery machines without a special operation license.
A veterans’ services organization may apply for a special operation license to operate up to 5 instant ticket lottery machines.
An operation licensee may be required by the Agency to qualify for and become authorized to operate under the Expanded Cashing Authority Program as set forth in COMAR 36.02.03.06.
An operation licensee shall locate the licensed instant ticket lottery machines in its primary meeting hall.
The Agency may restrict the permissible location within a facility of instant ticket lottery machines.
An operation licensee shall enter into an agreement with the Agency regarding the instant ticket lottery machine program that provides for the:
Payment of rent for the instant ticket lottery machines;
Power, utility, security, and HVAC needs of the instant ticket lottery machines; and
Operation, maintenance, ticket retention, record keeping, and reporting requirements of the instant ticket lottery machines.
An operation licensee may sell an instant ticket only to an individual who is 18 years old or older.
An operation licensee shall be:
Knowledgeable about the games available in the instant ticket lottery machine; and
Able to show players how to access help screens in the instant ticket lottery machine.
The purchase of an instant ticket may not be cancelled.
A cashout voucher may be presented for payment only to:
The operation licensee where the voucher was printed; or
An Agency claim center as defined in COMAR 36.02.06.01B(1).
Only a player who is an individual may present a cashout voucher for payment.
The provisions of COMAR 36.02.06.15 and COMAR 36.02.06.16 do not apply to claims for payment of a prize from an instant ticket lottery machine.
Except as provided in §§A—C of this regulation, an operation licensee shall pay the individual holder of a cashout voucher in accordance with the claims procedures described in COMAR 36.02.06.
